Title: Schuman 7 Lalo Espagnole Perlman Philadelphia Maazel Jan 1968 Live
Glinka Ruslan Shostakovich Vn Cto 1 Oistrakh Philadelphia Maazel Jan 1968 Live
Bruckner 3 Philadelphia Maazel Jan 1968 Live
Description: Lorin Maazel conducts the Philadelphia Orchestra in Bruckner's Symphony No. 3.  A commenter notes this is the third version.  It is well played, though there are a few horn glitches.  Some people swear by this work; I find myself swearing at it.  This was Philadelphia's introduction to the work, and by the uncharacteristic pause after the loud and clear final bars, it appears the audience was at least a little bit uncertain whether it was finally over.

Beethoven Violin Concerto - Cleveland Orchestra Maazel, Oliveira 1981
Description:
The Cleveland Orchestra performs Beethoven’s Violin Concerto sometime in 1981 at the Blossom Music Festival in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio. Lorin Maazel conducts and Elmar Oliveira is the featured soloist. 

I don’t have a lot of information about this recording other than what was written on the box by Mr. Marchant’s daughter. It says “Taped at Blossom Music Festival 1981.” That heavily implies that she taped it herself in person or got a copy from someone who did. I have other performances that she or her husband personally taped in the collection so it’s certainly possible. And of course her father taped many performances in person - lots of that on the channel. 

I could not find any more details about the performance, even with extensive newspaper archive searches. Maybe one of my subscribers can find out more. 

Technical Info:
Ampex 1800, quarter track stereo
7” reel
3 3/4 IPS
This tape suffers from sticky shed syndrome which means it has to be specially treated before being played. That process can result in some audio problems unfortunately. With this track there are some balance issues where the left channel is quieter than the right. I tried to adjust for this but there is only so much you can do. For more about the sticky shed treatment see my post here:
https://www.youtube.com/post/Ugkxh8TfxsulklceOY2PnuGTzfKIjI7Wvxiv

Title: Mahler Symphony No.1
Description:
Memory of Maestro Lorin Maazel (March 6, 1930 -- July 13, 2014)

Lorin Maazel was an American conductor, violinist and composer. He made his conducting debut at the age of eight. He started his career in 1953, establishing a reputation in European and US. He would later be appointed Artistic Director of the Deutsche Oper Berlin and General Manager of the Vienna State Opera, as Music Director of the Radio Symphony of Berlin, the Symphony Orchestra of the Bavarian Radio, the Pittsburgh Symphony, the Cleveland Orchestra, the Munich Philharmonic, and the New York Philharmonic.Lorin Maazel was an Honorary Member of the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra as well as the Vienna Philharmonic, with which he has conducted the New Year's Concert eleven times, and has received the Hans von Bülow Medal from the Berlin Philharmonic. Lorin Maazel died on July 13, 2014, at his Castleton Farms estate in Virginia, from complications of pneumonia.  

Mahler Symphony No.1 in D major

Title: Richard Wagner - Der Ring des Nibelungen 2009
Description: Der Ring des Nibelungen ist ein aus vier Teilen bestehender Opernzyklus von Richard Wagner, zu dem er den Text schrieb, die Musik komponierte und detaillierte szenische Anweisungen vorgab. An diesem Hauptwerk (auch „Opus magnum" genannt) hat Wagner mit Unterbrechungen von 1848 bis 1874 gearbeitet. Mit einer Aufführungsdauer von etwa 16 Stunden (ein Vorabend und drei Tage), einer Orchesterbesetzung von über 100 Musikern (u. a. 6 Harfen und 4 Tenor- bzw. Basstuben, die Wagner speziell anfertigen ließ) und mit 34 Solisten (plus Männer- und Frauenchor) ist es eines der umfangreichsten musikalischen Bühnenwerke überhaupt. Unter der Leitung des Komponisten wurde die gesamte Tetralogie (auch kurz „Der Ring" genannt) im August 1876 erstmals im Bayreuther Festspielhaus aufgeführt. Die musikalische Leitung hatte Hans Richter. Das Werk wird aber auch als Trilogie bezeichnet, weil in dieser Sichtweise nur die Festspieltage zählen. Wagner hat sich von den Dionysien beeinflussen lassen, bei der nach dem Vorabend des Festspiels am ersten Tag eine Tragödie, am zweiten Tag eine Komödie und am dritten Tag wiederum eine Tragödie gespielt wird. Das Werk 'Siegfried' stellt somit im Zyklus eher eine Komödie dar.

Title: R.Strauss Tod und Verklarung op.24
Description:
Memory of Maestro Lorin Maazel (March 6, 1930 -- July 13, 2014)

Lorin Maazel was an American conductor, violinist and composer. He made his conducting debut at the age of eight. He started his career in 1953, establishing a reputation in European and US. He would later be appointed Artistic Director of the Deutsche Oper Berlin and General Manager of the Vienna State Opera, as Music Director of the Radio Symphony of Berlin, the Symphony Orchestra of the Bavarian Radio, the Pittsburgh Symphony, the Cleveland Orchestra, the Munich Philharmonic, and the New York Philharmonic.Lorin Maazel was an Honorary Member of the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra as well as the Vienna Philharmonic, with which he has conducted the New Year's Concert eleven times, and has received the Hans von Bülow Medal from the Berlin Philharmonic. Lorin Maazel died on July 13, 2014, at his Castleton Farms estate in Virginia, from complications of pneumonia. 

R.Strauss Tod und Verklarung op.24
New York Philharmonic
Lorin Maazel

Title: ブルックナー／交響曲第3番／マゼール／ウィーンフィル （1985 5 16）
Description:
ブログ寸草春暉　
http://blog.goo.ne.jp/tgcy2801（1985 5 16）C1228A

ブルックナー／交響曲第3番ニ短調
ロリン・マゼール（指揮）／ウィーン・フィルハーモニー管弦楽団
（1985年5月16日 ウィーンコンツェルト・ハウス大ホールにて収録）

　私が最も好きな作曲家・交響曲はブルックナーの交響曲です。習作を入れて11曲の交響曲群ですが、初期の第2交響曲までの4曲は傑作とはいえない。この第3交響曲からブルックナーの個性が発揮され、未完の第9番までは傑作であると思う。

　ブルックナーの交響曲では「版」の問題があります。彼はすくなくとも「自信家・過信家」ではなかったらしく、曲を完成したそばから「手直し・改作」を始めるんですね。口汚い批評家から「こりゃだめだ」、楽団員からは「演奏できない」と言われれば、せっせと手直しします。特にこの第3番は、版が4～6種あるといわれていますが、当初の完成版（初稿）とその後のいくつかの改訂版の差は激しく、まったく別の曲です。

　愛好家は辛辣な批判や演奏をするわけではないので、音の響きとして味わえばいいわけですから、版が多いということはそれだけいろんな形を楽しめるということです。

Title: Live! The Cleveland Orchestra Plays Brahms Symphony No.1, Sydney Opera House, October, 04, 1973.
Description:
Almost 50 years ago, In September and October 1973, the Cleveland Orchestra embarked on long tour of Australia and New Zealand.  On 04 October 1973, the tour culminated in a concert at the recently opened Sydney Opera House.  The Cleveland Orchestra  was the first visiting orchestra to play in the iconic structure. The event was taped for broadcast on Australian Broadcasting, and later released in this special album to commemorate the tour.  It was a highly successful tour by the orchestra, who at the time was among the top four or five orchestras in the world (and it still remains a world class orchestra to this day.)

As this is a live recording there a few coughs and a bit of tape noise.  However, I did not cleanup this recording so it has what I imagine was the sound that would have been heard to a listener on the radio.

Tracks/Movements.

13:31    Second Movement ∙ Andante Sostenuto
23:51    Third Movement ∙ Un Poco Allegretto E Grazioso

Title: Canal 9 - Concert de Nadal dirigit per Lorin Maazel (2010) - Canal Nou 2 - RTVV - gener 2013.
Description:
Concert de Nadal al Palau de les Arts Reina Sofia de València, interpretat per l'Orquestra de la Comunitat Valenciana, i dirigit pel mestre Lorin Maazel, aleshores director del Palau de les Arts. Emés per Canal 9 al Nadal del 2010, i reemés per Canal Nou 2 al gener del 2013.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Concierto de Navidad en el Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía de Valencia, interpretado por la Orquesta de la Comunidad Valenciana, y dirigido por el maestro Lorin Maazel, entonces director del Palau de les Arts. Emitido por Canal 9 en Navidad de 2010, y reemitido por Canal Nou 2 en enero de 2013.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Christmas Concert at the Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía in Valencia, performed by the Orquestra de la Comunitat Valenciana, and conducted by maestro Lorin Maazel, who was then the director of the Palau de les Arts. Broadcast by Canal 9 (RTVV) in Christmas 2010, and rebroadcast by Canal Nou 2 in January 2013.

Title: Dvořák - Symphony No. 9 "From the New World" (Maazel, New York Philharmonic) |Pyongyang Concert(5/9)
Description:
From East Pyongyang Grand Theatre in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea:
The New York Philharmonic, under the baton of Lorin Maazel (March 6, 1930-July 13, 2014), performs "The Pyongyang Concert". 

Antonín Dvořák - Symphony No. 9 in E Minor, Op. 95 "From the New World"

00:00 Introduction
01:57 I. Adagio: Allegro Molto
11:19 II. Largo
23:29 III. Scherzo: Molto vivace
30:56 IV. Finale: Allegro con fuoco

New York Philharmonic
Lorin Maazel - conductor

Watch the full concert playlist here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hs64vj7VSxo&list=PLBjoEdEVMABJhjVC7yhP-X4G6yinvuTwa&index=1
Subscribe to EuroArts: https://goo.gl/jrui3M

In 2008, a historic event took place: The New York Philharmonic, under the baton of acclaimed conductor Lorin Maazel (1930-2014) traveled to Pyongyang, North Korea to perform a concert at East Pyongyang Grand Theatre. It was the first time since the Korean War that significant US-American cultural representatives were permitted to visit the secluded country. This event captures a historic moment in which music found itself navigating sensitive political realities, and revealed its unique power – the power to awaken human minds and to push for change by creating moments of communication, unity, and hope. 
The New York Philharmonic began the concert by performing the national anthems of North Korea and the United States, followed by a program that introduced the audience to European and US-American classics (such as Richard Wagner, George Bizet or Leonard Bernstein), and created moments of symbolic meaning: After performing pieces such as Antonín Dvořák's Symphony "From the New World" and George Gershwin's "An American in Paris", the orchestra closed the concert with the famous Korean folk song "Arirang", which is beloved in both, South and North Korea. 

Directed by Michael Beyer
Produced by Paul Smaczny

2008, EuroArts Music, in coproduction with Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation, ARTE France, Thirteen/WNET New York, in association with New York Philharmonic

Title: NDR Sinfonieorchester Lorin Maazel  u a  Dvorak aus der Neuen Welt 1986?
Wagner/Maazel: Der Ring ohne Worte | Norddeutsche Orchesterakademie, Kiril Stankow
Description:
Der berühmte Dirigent Lorin Maazel verdichtete den 16-stündigen Opernzyklus „Der Ring des Nibelungen“ einst auf 70 mitreißende Minuten: Wagners wuchtiges Welttheater – in nur einer Stunde! „Der Ring ohne Worte“ erklang erstmals 1987 in der Berliner Philharmonie, also genau dort, wo auch dieses Projekt gipfelte. 

Am 9. Juni 2019 spielten die 120 Musiker der Norddeutschen Orchesterakademie „Der Ring ohne Worte" von Richard Wagner/Lorin Maazel. Es dirigierte: Kiril Stankow. Mitschnitt eines unvergesslichen Abends.

Title: Barber - Overture to "The School of Scandal" (1986) | Lorin Maazel | NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchester
Description:
Das NDR Sinfonieorchester (heute: NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchester) spielt Samuel Barbers "Overture to 'The School of Scandal'" unter Leitung von Lorin Maazel. Das Werk ist Barbers erste Overtüre in Orchesterbesetzung. Barber komponierte es im Jahr 1931 - während er noch am Curtis Institute of Music im US-Bundesstaat Philadelphia studierte.
Eine Aufzeichnung aus dem Großen Sendesaal des NDR Landesfunkhauses Niedersachsen in Hannover, 6. Dezember 1986.

Samuel Barber - Overture to "The School of Scandal"

NDR Sinfonieorchester
Lorin Maazel, Dirigent
